00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * libcfs/include/libcfs/libcfs_workitem.h
00037  *
00038  * Author: Isaac Huang  <he.h.huang@oracle.com>
00039  *         Liang Zhen   <zhen.liang@sun.com>
00040  *
00041  * A workitems is deferred work with these semantics:
00042  * - a workitem always runs in thread context.
00043  * - a workitem can be concurrent with other workitems but is strictly
00044  *   serialized with respect to itself.
00045  * - no CPU affinity, a workitem does not necessarily run on the same CPU
00046  *   that schedules it. However, this might change in the future.
00047  * - if a workitem is scheduled again before it has a chance to run, it
00048  *   runs only once.
00049  * - if a workitem is scheduled while it runs, it runs again after it
00050  *   completes; this ensures that events occurring while other events are
00051  *   being processed receive due attention. This behavior also allows a
00052  *   workitem to reschedule itself.
00053  *
00054  * Usage notes:
00055  * - a workitem can sleep but it should be aware of how that sleep might
00056  *   affect others.
00057  * - a workitem runs inside a kernel thread so there's no user space to access.
00058  * - do not use a workitem if the scheduling latency can't be tolerated.
00059  *
00060  * When wi_action returns non-zero, it means the workitem has either been
00061  * freed or reused and workitem scheduler won't touch it any more.
00062  */
00063 
00064 #ifndef __LIBCFS_WORKITEM_H__
00065 #define __LIBCFS_WORKITEM_H__
00066 
00067 struct cfs_wi_sched;
00068 
00069 void cfs_wi_sched_destroy(struct cfs_wi_sched *);
00070 int cfs_wi_sched_create(char *name, struct cfs_cpt_table *cptab, int cpt,
00071                         int nthrs, struct cfs_wi_sched **);
00072 
00073 struct cfs_workitem;
00074 
00075 typedef int (*cfs_wi_action_t) (struct cfs_workitem *);
00076 
00077 struct cfs_workitem {
00079         struct list_head        wi_list;
00081         cfs_wi_action_t         wi_action;
00083         void                    *wi_data;
00085         unsigned short          wi_running:1;
00087         unsigned short          wi_scheduled:1;
00088 };
00089 
00090 static inline void
00091 cfs_wi_init(struct cfs_workitem *wi, void *data, cfs_wi_action_t action)
00092 {
00093         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&wi->wi_list);
00094 
00095         wi->wi_running   = 0;
00096         wi->wi_scheduled = 0;
00097         wi->wi_data      = data;
00098         wi->wi_action    = action;
00099 }
00100 
00101 void cfs_wi_schedule(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi);
00102 int  cfs_wi_deschedule(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi);
00103 void cfs_wi_exit(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi);
00104 
00105 int  cfs_wi_startup(void);
00106 void cfs_wi_shutdown(void);
00107 
00109 #define CFS_WI_RESCHED    128
00110 
00111 #endif /* __LIBCFS_WORKITEM_H__ */
